simulated_ratings.title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ruthless, quiet intensity and moral grayness had me locked in.

simulated_ratings.title: Big Lebowski, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Funny in spots, but the laid-back goofiness doesn't fully land for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Fargo (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, darkly funny crime spiral with characters and tension I love.

simulated_ratings.title: Sicario (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless, nerve-jangling and brutally grounded—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather, The (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, ruthless crime family saga that nails power and consequence.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather: Part II, The (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Deeper, colder and just as gripping—top-tier crime storytelling.

simulated_ratings.title: Skyfall (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek and weighty with great stakes, even if it runs a bit glossy.

simulated_ratings.title: Argo (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut, efficient rescue thriller that kept me engaged start to finish.

simulated_ratings.title: Goodfellas (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Propulsive, dangerous and addictive—gangster life at full throttle.

simulated_ratings.title: Deadwood: The Movie (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grit is there, but coming in cold left me less invested.

simulated_ratings.title: Bourne Ultimatum, The (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, high-stakes spy chase with satisfying momentum.

simulated_ratings.title: Tutta colpa di Freud (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sitcom-y entanglements and cutesy romance just aren't my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Rocky (1976)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gritty, heartfelt underdog story that still punches hard.

simulated_ratings.title: Casino Royale (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grounded, bruising Bond with stakes and swagger I actually buy.

simulated_ratings.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp, stylish and darkly hilarious—my kind of crime stew.

simulated_ratings.title: Animal House (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rowdy fun, though the broad frat antics wear thin for me.

simulated_ratings.title: This Is Spinal Tap (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dry, razor-sharp mockumentary that hits the satire sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Rewind This! (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Nostalgic and interesting, if a bit niche for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense, kinetic and smart enough to pull me right in.

simulated_ratings.title: Gone Baby Gone (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gritty moral knots and a great sense of place—loved it.

simulated_ratings.title: Hurt Locker, The (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: White-knuckle, immersive and unsentimental—blew me away.

simulated_ratings.title: Jaws (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic, clean suspense that still bites.

simulated_ratings.title: Raging Bull (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw and bruising, though its self-destruction keeps me at a remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Best in Show (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: National Lampoon's Vacation (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Amusing misadventures with laughs, if a bit dated.

simulated_ratings.title: Rushmore (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky and clever, but the twee vibe doesn't fully click for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Departed, The (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ferocious cat-and-mouse crime opera—totally my speed.

simulated_ratings.title: Silence of the Lambs, The (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Chilling, precise and unforgettable—top-shelf thriller.

simulated_ratings.title: Mike Birbiglia: The New One (2019)

simulated_ratings.title: Django Unchained (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stylish and punchy, though the pulpiness keeps it just shy of love.
